This bridge is a two span concrete encased structure, 153.3 feet wide, 75 feet long and carries a total of 9 lanes of traffic. The bridge itself is an integral part of the Woodhaven Blvd. subway station structure owned and operated by the MTA. The superstructure consists of concrete encased steel stringers framing into concrete encased steel columns which are also used to serve as the retaining wall holding up Queens Blvd. service road.
